transportAdvice: Wrocław has an extensive tram and bus network that connects the city centre with most tourist areas, making public transit a reliable and affordable option. The historic Old Town and Market Square are compact and very walkable, and taxis are widely available throughout the city.

weather.description: Cold and grey with occasional snow and frost, typical of a Central European winter.
Still cold and wintry with possible snow, though daylight hours begin to lengthen slightly.
Early spring brings milder temperatures and occasional rain, with the city starting to come alive.
Pleasant spring weather with blooming trees and longer days, though showers are common.
Warm and green with comfortable temperatures, one of the more enjoyable months to visit.
Warm early summer with occasional thunderstorms, ideal for outdoor sightseeing and café culture.
The warmest month of the year with long sunny days and occasional afternoon thunderstorms.
Warm and summery with similar conditions to July, great for exploring the islands and riverbanks.
Early autumn brings cooler, crisp air and beautiful foliage, a lovely time to visit.
Noticeably cooler with increasing cloud cover and rain, autumn colours peak mid-month.
Cold and often overcast with frequent rain and the first hints of frost toward month's end.
Cold winter month with a festive Christmas market atmosphere in the Old Town, occasional snow possible.
